clinical_study.brief_title: Stroke Unit in the Philippines: Is it Effective
clinical_study.official_title: Stroke Unit in the Philippines: Is it Effective?

lead_sponsor.agency: Jose R. Reyes Memorial Medical Center

clinical_study.source: Jose R. Reyes Memorial Medical Center

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to assess the effectiveness of Stroke Unit in the Philippines by comparing the functional outcome between those patient admitted in the general neurology wards and stroke units using modified Rankin Scale

detailed_description.textblock: This study aims to look into functionality of patient admitted in the stroke unit in the Philippines

secondary_outcome.measure: Functional outcome in modified rankin scale

study_pop.textblock: all consecutive patients diagnosed with stroke (ischemic and hemorrhagic) starting on June 2016.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All consecutive patients admitted in participating SUs starting June 2016 during acute stroke (within 7 days from onset), either hemorrhagic or ischemic stroke confirmed by CT-Scan or MRI, will be included
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient who had previous of stroke and secondary cause of intracerebral hemorrhage such as trauma, arteriovenous malformation and aneurysm are not included in the study. Those who transferred from other institutions will be excluded. And also, patients who are below 18 years old are excluded in the study
